page.title: 18HEALTH IN THIS AREA
page.content: There are no doctors practising in Etherley and Toft Hill, so medical care is mainly provided by the groups of General Practitioners in Bishop Auckland. This means a lot of home visits to people who would have difficulty getting to surgery. There is a small district general hospital in Bishop Auckland, and two of the Consultants who work there live in the village of Etherley. This area of Durham has a lower life expectancy than the national average for England and Wales, and this is because of several problems. Poor health is linked to the very high unemployment rate, a low average income, and a high rate of cigarette smoking. The older people in the community have health problems partly connected with poor conditions in the past, such as air pollution from coal
